Welcome to PhotoShare’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.block_blacklisted_tokens(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

The block_blacklisted_tokens function is a middleware function that checks if the access token in the Authorization header of an incoming request is blacklisted. If it is, then this function returns a 401 Unauthorized response. Otherwise, it passes control to the next handler.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Access the request object

  • call_next – Callable: Pass the request to the next middleware in line

Returns:

The result of calling the next handler in the chain

Doc-author:

RSA

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
main.index()¶
async main.startup()¶

REST API repository Admin¶

async src.repository.admin.change_user_status(user: User, is_active: bool, db: AsyncSession)¶

The change_user_status function changes the is_active status of a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass in the user that we want to change

  • is_active – bool: Set the user’s status to active or inactive

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.admin.delete_comment(comment_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The delete_comment function deletes a comment from the database.
Args:

comment_id (int): The id of the comment to be deleted. db (AsyncSession): An async session object for interacting with the database. user (User): A User object representing who is making this request, used for authorization purposes.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Specify the comment to delete

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Check if the user is allowed to delete the comment

Returns:

The comment that was deleted, or none if the comment didn’t exist

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.admin.update_user_role(user: User, role: Role, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_user_role function updates the role of a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass in the user object that we want to update

  • role – Role: Pass in the role that we want to update the user with

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

RSA

REST API repository Comments¶

async src.repository.comments.create_comment(image_id: int, text: str, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The create_comment function creates a comment for an image.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Specify the image that the comment is being made on

  • text – str: Store the text of the comment

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the user object

Returns:

The comment object if it is created successfully

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.comments.delete_comment(comment_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The delete_comment function deletes a comment from the database.
Args:

comment_id (int): The id of the comment to be deleted. db (AsyncSession): An async session object for interacting with the database. user (User): A User object representing who is deleting this post, used for authorization purposes.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Find the comment to delete

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is authorized to delete the comment

Returns:

The comment that was deleted, or none if no comment was found

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.comments.get_comments(image_id: int, limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_comments function returns a list of comments for the image with the given id. The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate through results.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Filter the comments by image_id

  • limit – int: Limit the number of comments returned

  • offset – int: Get the comments after a certain number of comments

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of comments for the given image

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.comments.update_contact(comment_id: int, text: str, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Identify the comment that is to be updated

  • text – str: Update the text of a comment

  • db – AsyncSession: Connect to the database

  • user – User: Make sure that the user who is updating the comment is also

Returns:

A comment object

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.images.add_tag_to_image(image_id: int, tag_name: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The add_tag_to_image function adds a tag to an image. Args:

image_id (int): The id of the image to add a tag to. tag_name (str): The name of the new tag.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Get the image from the database

  • tag_name – str: Get the tag name

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

An image object

The create_image function creates a new image in the database. Args:

user (User): The user who is creating the image. db (AsyncSession): An async session to interact with the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id of the image

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

  • **kwargs –

    Pass in the arguments of the function

Returns:

An image object

RSA

async src.repository.images.create_tag(tag_name: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The create_tag function takes a tag name and an async database session as arguments. It then queries the database for a tag with that name, if it exists. If it does not exist, it creates one and returns the new Tag object.

Parameters:

  • tag_name – str: Specify the name of the tag to be created

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A tag object

Doc-author:

RSA

The delete_image_from_db function deletes an image from the database.

Parameters:

  • image – Image: Pass the image object to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A coroutine

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.images.delete_tag_from_image(image_id: int, tag_name: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The delete_tag_from_image function deletes a tag from an image. Args:

image_id (int): The id of the image to delete the tag from. tag_name (str): The name of the tag to be deleted.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Find the image in the database

  • tag_name – str: Specify the tag name to be deleted from the image

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

The image object with the tag removed

async src.repository.images.file_is_image(file: UploadFile)¶

The file_is_image function checks if the file is an image.

Parameters:

file – UploadFile: Check if the file is an image

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.images.format_filename()¶

The format_filename function takes no arguments and returns a string. The string is the filename of an image that has been uploaded to the server, with its extension removed and replaced with a UUID4 hexadecimal identifier.

Returns:

A random string of 32 characters

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.images.get_file_size(file)¶

The get_file_size function takes a file object as an argument and returns the size of that file in bytes. The function first reads the entire contents of the file into memory, then uses Python’s built-in len() function to get the length (i.e., number of characters) in that string, which is equivalent to getting the size of a binary file.

Parameters:

file – Pass in the file object

Returns:

The size of the file in bytes

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.images.get_filename_from_cloudinary_url(cloudinary_url)¶

The get_filename_from_cloudinary_url function takes a Cloudinary URL as input and returns the filename of the image.

Parameters:

cloudinary_url – Get the filename from the url

Returns:

The filename from the cloudinary url

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.images.get_image(image_id: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_image function takes an image_id and a database session as arguments. It then queries the Image table for the row with that id, returning it if found.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Specify the image id to search for

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

An image object

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.images.get_images(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_images function returns a list of images from the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of images returned

  • offset – int: Get the next set of images

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of image objects

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.images.get_images_by_tag(tag_name: str, limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_images_by_tag function takes in a tag name, limit, offset and database session. It then queries the Tag table for the given tag name. If it finds a match it will query the Image table for all images that contain that tag and return them as an array of image objects.

Parameters:

  • tag_name – str: Filter the images by tag name

  • limit – int: Limit the number of images returned

  • offset – int: Skip a certain number of images

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of images with a given tag

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.images.get_tag(tag_name: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_tag function takes a tag name and an async database session as arguments. It then creates a query to select the Tag object with the given name from the database. The result of this query is returned asynchronously.

Parameters:

  • tag_name – str: Specify the name of the tag to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A single row from the database

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.images.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.images.get_user_image(image_id: int, user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_user_image function is used to retrieve a single image from the database. It takes in an image_id and user object, and returns a single Image object if it exists.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Filter the images by id

  • user – User: Filter the images by user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The image that matches the given id and user

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.images.get_user_images(limit: int, offset: int, user: User, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_user_images function returns a list of images for the given user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of images returned

  • offset – int: Determine the offset of images to return

  • user – User: Get the user_id of the user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

A list of images

REST API repository Transform¶

async src.repository.transform.generate_qr_code(data)¶

The generate_qr_code function takes in a string of data and returns a QR code image.

Parameters:

data – Store the data that is to be encoded in the qr code

Returns:

A qr code image

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.transform.transform_image(image_url, transformation_options=None)¶

The transform_image function takes in an image_url and transformation_options. The function then transforms the image using cloudinary’s url method, which returns a transformed url and options. The function then returns the transformed url.

Parameters:

  • image_url – Specify the image to be transformed

  • transformation_options – Pass in the transformation options to be applied to the image

Returns:

A transformed image url

Doc-author:

RSA

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True. It also sets their is_active field to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A boolean value of true if the user’s email has been confirmed

Doc-author:

RSA

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserCreateSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes an email address and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object or none if no user with the given email exists

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_id(user_id: UUID, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_id function returns a user object from the database, given an id.

Parameters:

  • user_id – uuid.UUID: Specify the type of the user_id parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object or none if the user is not found

RSA

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

  • url – str: Specify the type of the parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The updated user object

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.users.update_password(user: User, new_password: str, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_password function takes a user object, a new password string, and an async database session. It updates the user’s password to the new_password string and commits it to the database. Then it refreshes that user object from the database so that we can be sure we have all of its attributes.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass in the user object that we want to update

  • new_password – str: Pass the new password to the function

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The updated user object

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user to update

  • token – str | None: Update the refresh token of the user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

RSA

REST API routes Admin¶

async src.routes.admin.admin_delete_image(body: ImageRequest = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The admin_delete_image function is used to delete an image from the database and cloudinary. The function takes in a body of type ImageRequest, which contains the id of the image to be deleted. It then queries for that image in the database, and if it exists, deletes it from both cloudinary and our own database.

Parameters:

  • body – ImageRequest: Get the image_id from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A 204 status code if the image was successfully deleted

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.admin.change_user_status_by_email(body: UserStatusUpdate = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The change_user_status_by_email function changes the status of a user by email.

Parameters:

  • body – UserStatusUpdate: Get the email and is_active values from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.admin.delete_comment(comment_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The delete_comment function deletes a comment from the database.

The function takes in an integer representing the id of the comment to be deleted, and returns a Comment object that has been deleted.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Identify the comment to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The comment that was deleted

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.admin.unblock_user_by_email(body: UserStatusUpdate = Depends(NoneType), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The unblock_user_by_email function is used to unblock a user by email. It takes in the body of the request, which contains an email and a boolean value for whether or not they are active. The function then gets the user from the database using their email address, and if it finds them, changes their status to active or inactive depending on what was passed in.

Parameters:

  • body – UserStatusUpdate: Get the email and is_active parameters from the request body

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

:param : Get the user’s email address :return: A dict with a message :doc-author: RSA

async src.routes.admin.update_image_by_admin(body: ImageUpdateSchema = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_image_by_admin function updates the title of an image. The function takes in a body parameter, which is a dictionary containing the image_id and title of the image to be updated. The function also takes in a db parameter, which is an async session object that allows us to interact with our database.

Parameters:

  • body – ImageUpdateSchema: Get the image_id and title from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The updated image

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.admin.update_user_role(body: UserRoleUpdate = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_user_role function updates the role of a user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserRoleUpdate: Get the user_id and role from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the message key

Doc-author:

RSA

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → ConfirmationResponse¶

The confirmed_email function takes a token and database session as input. It returns a ConfirmationResponse object with the message &quot;Email confirmed&quot; if successful. If unsuccessful, it raises an HTTPException with status code 400 and detail &quot;Verification error&quot;.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A confirmationresponse object

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user. It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies them against the database, and returns an access token.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.auth.logout(access_token: str = Depends(get_user_access_token), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

The logout function is used to logout a user. It takes an access token as input and returns a message indicating that the logout was successful.

Parameters:

  • access_token – str: Get the access token from the authorization header

  • user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database session

Returns:

A dict with a message

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access token, a new refresh token, and the type of authentication being used (bearer). If there is no valid user associated with the given email address or if there are any errors during this process then an HTTPException will be raised.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their account. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already a confirmed user with that email address, and if so returns an error message saying that this account has already been confirmed. If not, it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Validate the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with a message

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.auth.signup(background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, body: UserCreateSchema = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user.

Parameters:

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the request

  • body – UserCreateSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Send the email in the background :return: A dict with a user and detail :doc-author: RSA

REST API routes Comments¶

async src.routes.comments.create_comment(image_id: int, text: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user=Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_comment function creates a new comment for an image. The function takes the following parameters:

  • image_id: int, the id of the image to which we want to add a comment.

  • text: str, the text of our new comment.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Specify the image that the comment is being made on

  • text – str: Get the text of the comment from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user – Get the current user

Returns:

A comment object

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.comments.delete_comment(comment_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The delete_comment function deletes a comment from the database. The function takes in an integer representing the id of the comment to be deleted, and returns a dictionary containing information about that comment.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Specify the id of the comment to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A comment object

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.comments.get_comments(image_id: int, limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_comments function returns a list of comments for the image with the given id. The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate through results.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Specify the image id of the comment

  • limit – int: Limit the number of comments returned

  • ge – Specify the minimum value of the limit parameter

  • le – Set a maximum value for the limit parameter

  • offset – int: Specify the offset of the first comment to be returned

  • ge – Specify a minimum value for the integer, and le is used to specify a maximum

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of comments for the image with the given id

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.comments.update_comment(comment_id: int, text: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user=Depends(get_current_user))¶

The update_comment function updates a comment in the database. The function takes an id of the comment to be updated, and a new text for that comment. It returns the updated contact.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Specify the id of the comment to be deleted

  • text – str: Update the text of a comment

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

  • user – Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A comment object

Doc-author:

RSA

REST API routes Images¶

async src.routes.images.add_tag_to_image(image_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), tag: str = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The add_tag_to_image function adds a tag to an image.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Specify the image id

  • tag – str: Get the tag from the path

  • min_length – Specify the minimum length of a string

  • max_length – Limit the length of the input string

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A dictionary with the following structure:

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.images.create_image(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), title: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), tag: str | None = None, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The create_image function creates a new image in the database.

It takes an UploadFile object, which is a file that has been uploaded to the server. The title and tag are optional parameters, but if they are provided they must be valid strings.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request body

  • description – Provide a description for the image

  • title – str: Set the title of the image

  • max_length – Limit the number of characters in a string

  • tag – Optional[str]: Indicate that the tag parameter is optional

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the image data

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.images.delete_image(image_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The delete_image function deletes an image from the database and cloudinary. The function takes in a user object, which is used to verify that the user has permission to delete this image. It also takes in an integer representing the id of the image we want to delete.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Get the image id from the path

  • user – User: Get the user object from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

Returns:

A dictionary with the key &quot;detail&quot; and value &quot;image successfully deleted&quot;

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.images.delete_tag_from_image(image_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), tag: str = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The delete_tag_from_image function deletes a tag from an image. Args:

image_id (int): The id of the image to delete the tag from. tag (str): The name of the tag to delete.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Specify the image id of the image to be deleted

  • tag – str: Get the tag from the url path

  • min_length – Specify the minimum length of a string

  • max_length – Limit the length of the input string

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

The number of rows affected by the query

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.images.download_picture(image_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The download_picture function downloads a picture from the database.

The function takes an image_id as input and returns the image if it exists in the database. If not, it raises a 404 error.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Specify the image id of the image that is to be downloaded

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A streamingresponse object, which is a special type of response that allows

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.images.get_all_images(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_all_images function returns a list of all images in the database. The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate the results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of images returned

  • ge – Specify the minimum value of the parameter

  • le – Limit the number of images returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before returning results

  • ge – Specify the minimum value of the parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection from the dependency

Returns:

A list of images

Doc-author:

RSA

The get_image function returns an image with the given ID. If no such image exists, a 404 Not Found error is returned.

  • image_id – int: Get the image id from the path

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with the following keys:

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.images.get_images_by_tag(tag: str = Path(PydanticUndefined), limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_images_by_tag function returns a list of images that have the specified tag. The function takes in an optional limit and offset query parameters to control how many results are returned, and where in the result set they start from. The default values for these parameters are 10 and 0 respectively.

Parameters:

  • tag – str: Get the tag from the request url

  • min_length – Specify the minimum length of the tag

  • max_length – Limit the length of the input tag

  • limit – int: Limit the number of images returned

  • ge – Specify the minimum value of a parameter

  • le – Limit the number of images returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of images to skip

  • ge – Check if the value is greater than or equal to the given number

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of images that contain the tag

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.images.get_images_by_user(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_images_by_user function is used to get all images uploaded by a user. The function takes in the following parameters:

limit - an integer that specifies how many images should be returned at once (defaults to 10) offset - an integer that specifies where in the list of all images uploaded by a user, we should start returning from (defaults to 0)

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of images returned

  • ge – Specify the minimum value for a parameter, and le is used to specify the maximum value

  • le – Limit the number of images returned to a maximum of 500

  • offset – int: Skip the first offset number of images

  • ge – Specify the minimum value, and le is used to specify the maximum value

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the user from the auth_service

Returns:

A list of images

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.images.update_image(image_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), title: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_image function updates the title of an image.

  • title – str: Get the new title of the image

  • max_length – Limit the length of the title

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The updated image

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.forgot_password(background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, body: RequestEmail = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

The forgot_password function is used to send an email to the user with a link to reset their password. The function takes in the request object, which contains the base_url of the application, and a body containing an email address. It then uses this information to create a task that will be executed by Celery.

Parameters:

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A json response with a message

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.users.get_reset_password_page(token: str, request_: Request)¶

The get_reset_password_page function is a GET request that returns the reset_password.html page, which allows users to enter their new password and confirm it.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Pass the token to the reset_password

  • request – Request: Pass the request object to the template

Returns:

A templateresponse object

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function is a GET endpoint that returns the current user’s information. It uses the auth_service to get the current user, and then returns it.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.users.reset_password(token: str, request_: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → dict¶

The reset_password function is used to reset a user’s password. It takes in the token that was sent to the user’s email address, and then it uses that token to get the email of the user who requested a password reset. It then gets that user from the database, hashes their new password, and updates their account with this new hashed password.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • request – Request: Get the form data from the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dict object

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) → User¶

The update_avatar_user function is used to update the avatar of a user. The function takes in an UploadFile object, which contains the file that will be uploaded to Cloudinary. It also takes in a User object, which represents the current user who is logged into their account and making this request. Finally it takes in an AsyncSession object, which represents our database session for interacting with our PostgreSQL database.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file that is being uploaded

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

RSA

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = '81ca0de60255b6e2b16b03a717a11c35dc24d8e565fd4f388a876de40d21d9ce'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token. Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds, the access token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 4 minutes.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the data passed to it

Doc-author:

RSA

async create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes in a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created using the JWT library, which encodes the data into a string that can be decoded later. The function also adds an expiration date to the encoded data.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the user class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded

Returns:

A token that is encoded using the jwt library

Doc-author:

RSA

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user. Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the token expires, defaults to 30 days if not specified.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s id and username

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

An encoded refresh token

Doc-author:

RSA

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function takes a refresh token and decodes it. If the scope is ‘refresh_token’, then we return the email address of the user who owns that token. Otherwise, we raise an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail message &quot; Invalid scope for token&quot;. If there’s a JWTError, then we also raise an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail message &quot;Could not validate credentials&quot;.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user who is logged in

Doc-author:

RSA

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the protected route. It takes an OAuth2 token as input and returns the user object if it’s valid, or raises an exception otherwise.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Get the token from the header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

RSA

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to return the email address.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Get the token from the request

Returns:

The email from the token

Doc-author:

RSA

async get_password_hash(password) → str¶

The get_password_hash function is a helper function that hashes the password using the passlib library. The hashing algorithm used by this function is PBKDF2 with HMAC-SHA256, which is considered to be one of the most secure algorithms available today.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – Hash the password

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

RSA

async get_token_expiration_time(token: str)¶

The get_token_expiration_time function takes a token as an argument and returns the expiration time of that token. If the token is invalid, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that is being decoded

Returns:

The expiration time of the token

Doc-author:

RSA

async get_user_access_token(access_token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer))¶

The get_user_access_token function is a dependency that will be used by the get_current_user function. It takes an access token as input and returns it. The access token is provided by the oauth2_scheme dependency, which uses the OAuth2PasswordBearer scheme to validate the user’s credentials.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class variables and methods

  • access_token – str: Get the access token from the request

Returns:

The access_token

Doc-author:

RSA

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
async verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password) → bool¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and a hashed password, and returns True if the two match. This is used to verify that the user’s inputted password matches what we have stored in our database.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Store the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Verify the plain_password parameter

Returns:

True if the plain_password matches the hashed_password, and false otherwise

Doc-author:

RSA

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address. The function takes in three parameters:

-email: EmailStr, the user’s email address. -username: str, the username of the user who is registering for an account. This will be used in a greeting message. -host: str, this is where we are hosting our application (e.g., http://localhost). This will be used as part of our confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass the username to the email template

  • host – str: Provide the host of the application to be used in the email template

Returns:

A coroutine object that can be awaited

Doc-author:

RSA

async src.services.email.send_email_reset_password(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email_reset_password function sends an email to the user with a link to reset their password. Args:

email (str): The user’s email address. username (str): The username of the user who is requesting a password reset. host (str): The hostname of the server where this function is being called from.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the user who wants to reset their password

  • username – str: Get the username of the user who is trying to reset his password

  • host – str: Create the link to reset password

Returns:

A message that is sent to the user’s email address

Doc-author:

RSA
